definition: kW (kilowatt) is a measure of instantaneous power demand. It is often used when discussing peak demand reduction.
kWh (kilowatt-hour) is a measure of energy over time. It is used to describe energy savings from efficiency measures.
Energy efficiency (EE) refers to measures that reduce energy use while maintaining the same service or output.
Energy Efficiency Cost Recovery Factor. A rate mechanism used to recover certain energy efficiency program costs (see ยง25.182).
Evaluation, measurement, and verification. Methods used to quantify and validate energy savings and demand impacts (see ยง25.183).
A program structure where incentives are paid for verified savings, typically through standard measures and reporting requirements.
The highest level of electricity demand during a specific period. Efficiency programs often target peak reduction for system reliability and cost control.
Transmission and Distribution Utility. In many Texas areas, TDUs implement certain programs even when retail choice exists.
